required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of Sunitinib In Combination With Cisplatin And 5-Fluorouracil In Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study Of Sunitinib Malate In Combination With Cisplatin And 5-Fluorouracil In Patients With Advanced Gastric Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safe and tolerable dose of sunitinib when given together with cisplatin and 5-fluorouracil in patients with advanced gastric cancer who have not received prior chemotherapy for their advanced cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First-cycle Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of DLTs assessed during the first cycle (21 days).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours Postdose [AUC (0-24)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours postdose)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 (pre-dose) to 24 hours postdose (0-24).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time to first occurrence of maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
secondary_outcome.description: Steady state plasma concentration of 5-FU equals AUC(2-6) divided by 4, where AUC(2-6) is the area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 2 to 6 hours postdose (2-6).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
secondary_outcome.description: Infusion rate of 5-FU equals total dose divided by infusion time.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
secondary_outcome.description: Steady state total body clearance equals infusion rate (zero order) divided by steady state plasma concentration of 5-FU (R0/Css).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time 2 to 6 Hours Postdose [AUC (2-6)] of 5-FU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 2 to 6 hours postdose (2-6).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 21 of every even-numbered cycle up to 15 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with an objective response-based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR defined as greater than or equal to (â‰¥) 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

Time from the first objective documentation of tumor response (confirmed or partial response) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurrs first. DR calculated as (Months) equals (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 30.

Median time (50%) from the first dose of study treatment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. PFS calculated as (Months) equals (first event date minus first dose date plus 1) divided by 30.

intervention.description: 5- fluorouracil is given as 4000 mg/m^2 total dose over 96 hr continuous infusion of a 21 day chemotherapy cycle. Each 21 day cycle is repeated until progression of disease or unacceptable toxicity is observed.
Cisplatin is given 80 mg/m^2 through a vein on day 1 every 21 days. Each 21 day cycle is repeated until progression of disease or unacceptable toxicity is observed.
sunitinib is given orally 37.5mg /day for 14 days followed by 7 days of drug free period. Each 21 day cycle is repeated until progression of disease or unacceptable toxicity is observed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- confirmed diagnosis of stomach cancer
- advanced stomach cancer stage IV
- adequate blood chemistry, blood counts and kidney function
- willing to participate to study requirements and to sign an informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- prior chemotherapy for stomach cancer in its advanced stage
- excessive toxicities related to prior therapies
- pregnant or breastfeeding patients

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Sunitinib (25 mg) in Combination With Cisplatin and 5-FU
group.description: Sunitinib: 25 milligram (mg) oral capsule daily for 2 weeks (Day 1 to 14) followed by 1 week (Day 15 to 21) off treatment. Cisplatin: 80 mg per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenous on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU): 4000 mg/m^2 continuous infusion for 96 hours starting Day 1 and ending Day 5 of each 21-day cycle.

group.title: Sunitinib (37.5 mg) in Combination With Cisplatin and 5-FU
group.description: Sunitinib: 37.5 mg oral capsule daily for 2 weeks (Day 1 to 14) followed by 1 week (Day 15 to 21) off treatment. Cisplatin: 80 mg per meter squared (mg/m^2) on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU): 4000 mg/m^2 continuous infusion for 96 hours starting Day 1 and ending Day 5 of each 21-day cycle.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With First-cycle Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
outcome.description: The incidence of DLTs assessed during the first cycle (21 days).
outcome.population: Safety: enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With First-cycle Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
measure.description: The incidence of DLTs assessed during the first cycle (21 days).
measure.population: Safety: enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours post dose)
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK): participants who received Sunitinib and had sufficient plasma concentration data for calculation of PK parameters; N=number of participants contributing to summary statistics. Cmax of Sunitinib, SU012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662) calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at maximum tolerated dose.

group.title: Sunitinib (25 mg) in Combination With Cisplatin and 5-FU
group.description: Sunitinib: 25 milligram (mg) oral capsule daily for 2 weeks (Day 1 to 14) followed by 1 week (Day 15 to 21) off treatment. Cisplatin: 80 mg per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenous on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU): 4000 mg/m^2 continuous infusion for 96 hours starting Day 1 and ending Day 5 of each 21-day cycle.

measure.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK): participants who received Sunitinib and had sufficient plasma concentration data for calculation of PK parameters; N=number of participants contributing to summary statistics. Cmax of Sunitinib, SU012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662) calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at maximum tolerated dose.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours Postdose [AUC (0-24)]
outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 (pre-dose) to 24 hours postdose (0-24).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 24 hours postdose)
outcome.population: PK; N=the number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. AUC(0-24) of Sunitinib, SU012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662) calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the maximum tolerated dose (MTD; 25 mg Sunitinib).

group.title: Sunitinib (25 mg) in Combination With Cisplatin and 5-FU

measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 0 (pre-dose) to 24 hours postdose (0-24).
measure.population: PK; N=the number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. AUC(0-24) of Sunitinib, SU012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662) calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the maximum tolerated dose (MTD; 25 mg Sunitinib).

measure.population: PK; N=the number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. Tmax of Sunitinib, SU012662, and Total Drug (Sunitinib + SU012662) calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the MTD (25 mg Sunitinib).

outcome.title: Steady State Concentration (Css) of 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU)
outcome.description: Steady state plasma concentration of 5-FU equals AUC(2-6) divided by 4, where AUC(2-6) is the area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 2 to 6 hours postdose (2-6).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
outcome.population: PK; N=number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. Css calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the MTD (25 mg Sunitinib).

group.title: Sunitinib (25 mg) in Combination With Cisplatin and 5-FU
group.description: Sunitinib: 25 milligram (mg) oral capsule daily for 2 weeks (Day 1 to 14) followed by 1 week (Day 15 to 21) off treatment. Cisplatin: 80 mg per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenous on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU): 4000 mg/m^2 continuous infusion for 96 hours starting Day 1 and ending Day 5 of each 21-day cycle.

measure.title: Steady State Concentration (Css) of 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU)
measure.description: Steady state plasma concentration of 5-FU equals AUC(2-6) divided by 4, where AUC(2-6) is the area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time 2 to 6 hours postdose (2-6).
measure.population: PK; N=number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. Css calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the MTD (25 mg Sunitinib).

outcome.title: Infusion Rate (Zero Order) (R0) of 5-FU
outcome.description: Infusion rate of 5-FU equals total dose divided by infusion time.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
outcome.population: PK; N= number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. R0 calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the MTD (25 mg Sunitinib).

group.title: Sunitinib (25 mg) in Combination With Cisplatin and 5-FU

Cisplatin: 80 mg per meter squared (mg/m^2) intravenous on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. 5-Fluorouracil (5-FU): 4000 mg/m^2 continuous infusion for 96 hours starting Day 1 and ending Day 5 of each 21-day cycle.

measure.description: Infusion rate of 5-FU equals total dose divided by infusion time.
measure.population: PK; N= number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. R0 calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the MTD (25 mg Sunitinib).

outcome.title: Clearance (CLss) of 5-FU
outcome.description: Steady state total body clearance equals infusion rate (zero order) divided by steady state plasma concentration of 5-FU (R0/Css).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 (2, 4, and 6 hours post infusion)
outcome.population: PK; N=the number of participants contributing to the summary statistics. CLss calculated for at least 6 individual participants treated at the MTD (25 mg Sunitinib).

CR defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR defined as greater than or equal to (â‰¥) 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

outcome.population: Efficacy: all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication. N=number of participants with measurable disease at baseline.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: Time from the first objective documentation of tumor response (confirmed or partial response) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurrs first. DR calculated as (Months) equals (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 30.

DR calculated as (Months) equals (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 30.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Median time (50%) from the first dose of study treatment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. PFS calculated as (Months) equals (first event date minus first dose date plus 1) divided by 30.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
